intro: Cardaminopsis multijuga, commonly known as the mountain buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many showy, often toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, yellow flowers and trifoliate leaves, which are typically palmately arranged. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and alpine meadows. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is often considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
